title: Chief Information Officer
summary: Lead strategic technology initiatives for 38,000+ students and 9,000 faculty/staff. Oversee enterprise systems, cybersecurity, digital transformation, and academic technology infrastructure.

title: Associate Vice President for Information Technology
summary: Direct comprehensive IT strategy and operations for premier research institution. Manage enterprise infrastructure, academic technology services, and digital innovation initiatives.

title: Director of Information Technology Services
summary: Oversee mission-critical IT services including network infrastructure, cloud platforms, and emerging technologies. Collaborate with academic departments to enhance research computing capabilities.

title: VP of Information Technology & CIO
summary: Lead digital transformation across campus serving 16,000+ students and 40,000+ faculty/staff. Manage enterprise technology portfolio, cybersecurity strategy, and educational technology innovation.

title: Director of Education Technology
summary: Bryan University is seeking a Director of Educational Technology to enhance student learning through innovative technology use in hybrid and online settings, with a focus on promoting AI adoption and staying abreast of emerging technologies. The ideal candidate will work remotely from one of the specified states and will collaborate with internal stakeholders to integrate cutting-edge educational tools. This position offers a competitive salary of $90,000-$100,000, a comprehensive benefits package, and is part of a recognized top workplace in Arizona.

title: Solutions Manager, Learning Technologies
summary: DeVry University is seeking an Academic Technology Solutions Manager to oversee the planning, implementation, and management of academic technology solutions, aligning them with the university's strategic goals. Key responsibilities include evaluating and managing technologies such as LMS and collaboration platforms, collaborating with faculty and IT to meet pedagogical needs, and serving as a subject matter expert. The ideal candidate should excel in vendor relationship management, data-driven decision-making, and effectively communicating complex technology strategies to executive leadership.

title: Learning Technologies Administrator, Office Of Academic Technology
summary: Fielding University seeks a Learning Technologies Administrator to oversee and support its academic technology systems, including Moodle, Turnitin, Zoom, SharePoint, G Suite, and Grammarly. Key responsibilities include system management, user support, and ensuring seamless integration of these platforms. Ideal candidates will have experience in educational technology management and strong technical skills to enhance the institution's digital learning environment.

title: Vice President of Academic Affairs â€“ Technology-Integrated Curriculum Development (Position Requires Relocation to Kuwait)
summary: The institution is seeking a dynamic Dean of Information Technology Academic Programs to lead and innovate curricula in AI, cybersecurity, data science, and cloud computing, ensuring alignment with industry standards and global best practices. Key responsibilities include curriculum development, accreditation, faculty collaboration, and fostering partnerships with tech companies and government agencies to enhance educational offerings and career opportunities. Ideal candidates will have a robust background in higher education and the IT industry, capable of expanding executive education and integrating digital learning technologies.
